bio.p: Peng Zhan obtained his B.S. degree from Shandong University, China, in 2005. Then he earned his M.S. degree and Ph.D. in medicinal chemistry from Shandong University in 2008 and 2010, respectively. He subsequently joined the research group of Professor Xinyong Liu as a Lecturer (2010â€“2012). From 2012 to 2014, he worked as a Postdoctoral Fellow funded by JSPS (Japan Society for the Promotion of Science) in the Graduate School of Medical Science, Kyoto Prefectural University of Medicine, Japan. He is currently an associate professor in the Institute of Medicinal Chemistry, Shandong University. His research interests involve the discovery of novel antiviral, anticancer, and neurodegenerative diseases-related agents based on rational drug design and combinatorial chemistry approaches.
